com.serena.dmclient.api
Interface ItemRevision

All Superinterfaces:
DimensionsArObject, DimensionsLcObject, DimensionsObject
public interface ItemRevision
extends DimensionsLcObject

Represent a Dimensions item revision with optional attribute values and relationships populated into its cache.

This class corresponds to a single revision of an item in the repository. Some attributes are only available if the revision is within the context of a container such as project, stream, baseline or release.

                         boolean expandSubstitutionVariables,
                         boolean overwriteWritableFiles,
                         boolean applySystemTime)
Writes the content of the repository file to disk

Parameters:
destinationFileName - the file name on disk that will contain the item
expandSubstitutionVariables - determines whether the substitution variable should be expanded
overwriteWritableFiles - determines whether the local file should be overwritten (if it is writable)
applySystemTime - determines whether the local file should have the current system timestamp as creation date
Returns:
DimensionsResult the result of the operation

checkOut

DimensionsResult checkOut(java.lang.String fileName,
                          boolean overwriteWritableFiles,
                          boolean applySystemTime,
                          java.lang.String[] chdocIds,
                          ItemRevisionDetails details,
                          Project project,
                          java.lang.String revision,
                          java.lang.String codepage,
                          boolean metadata)
Checks out the current item revision

Parameters:
fileName - the file name on disk that will contain the item
overwriteWritableFiles - determines whether the local file should be overwritten (if it is writable)
applySystemTime - determines whether the local file should have the current system timestamp as creation date
chdocIds - (optional) the ids of the requests this item revision should be in response to
details - (optional) Details about the revision to be created.
project - If specified, the new revision of the item will be placed in the project (useful it item come from Baseline).
revision - Sets the revision of the item to be created
codepage - Defines the method of encoding characters.
Returns:
DimensionsResult the result of the operation
Throws:
DimensionsRuntimeException - if the operation failed

                          boolean overwriteWritableFiles,
                          boolean applySystemTime,
                          java.lang.String[] chdocIds,
                          ItemRevisionDetails details)

Parameters:

applySystemTime - determines whether the local file should have the current system timestamp as creation date

details - (optional) Details about the revision to be created.

DimensionsResult the result of the operation

getNextRevision

java.lang.String[] getNextRevision(java.lang.String branchName)
Returns the next default revision number for this revision for the given branch name This revision is being calculated based on the current project. The user has to set the appropriate project as current project on the connection before using this method.

Parameters:
branchName - branch name to get the next default revision number for. Passing in null will return the next default revision. Passing in an empty string will return the next trunk revision.
Returns:
String array with two entries: 0=Branch Name, 1=Revision Number

revise

DimensionsResult revise(java.lang.String fileName,
                        java.lang.String comment,
                        boolean keepCopy,
                        boolean forceUpdate,
                        java.lang.String status,
                        java.lang.String[] chdocIds,
                        ItemRevisionDetails details,
                        java.lang.String contentEncoding)
Revises the current item revision ('UI' command-line).

Parameters:
fileName - The file name on disk to take the new file content from.
comment - Comment for the new revision.
keepCopy - true if a copy of this file should be kept.
forceUpdate - true if the file should always be updated even if content is unchanged and checksums are being maintained.
status - A valid changed lifecycle state for the new revision.
chdocIds - (optional) The String IDs of the requests this item revision should be in response to.
details - (optional) Details about the revision to be created.
contentEncoding - Specifies the content encoding for the new revision to be created. If not supplied, the standard encoding is used. See TextEncodings for possible values.
Returns:
DimensionsResult the result of the operation.

revise

                        java.lang.String comment,
                        boolean keepCopy,
                        boolean forceUpdate,
                        java.lang.String status,
                        java.lang.String[] chdocIds,
                        ItemRevisionDetails details)

comment - Comment for the new revision.
keepCopy - true if a copy of this file should be kept.
forceUpdate - true if the file should always be updated even if content is unchanged and checksums are being maintained.
status - A valid changed lifecycle state for the new revision.
chdocIds - (optional) The String IDs of the requests this item revision should be in response to.
details - (optional) Details about the revision to be created.
Returns:
DimensionsResult the result of the operation.

checkIn

DimensionsResult checkIn(java.lang.String fileName,
                         java.lang.String comment,
                         boolean keepCopy,
                         boolean forceUpdate,
                         java.lang.String status,
                         int[] attrNums,
                         java.lang.String contentEncoding,
                         java.lang.String codepage,
                         boolean cancelUnchanged)
Checks in the current item revision within the project that is related to the item. Checked out items will always have a related project, as they cannot come from a baseline.

Parameters:
fileName - the file name on disk to take the file from
comment - Comment for the new revision
keepCopy - Should a copy of this file be kept
forceUpdate - Should file be checked-in even if content is unchanged
status - A valid changed status
attrNums - list of attribute numbers that should be updated on check in. Values should be set on the object itself beforehand
contentEncoding - Specifies the content encoding for the new revision to be created. If not supplied, standard encoding is used. See TextEncodings.java for possible values.
codepage - Specifies the code page to be associated with the item.
cancelUnchanged - Performs a CIU (Cancel Item Update) command if the user file does not differ from the base revision and Dimensions is configured to allow updates only if a real change is made.
Returns:
DimensionsResult the result of the operation

checkIn

                         java.lang.String comment,
                         boolean keepCopy,
                         boolean forceUpdate,
                         java.lang.String status,
                         int[] attrNums,
                         java.lang.String contentEncoding)

keepCopy - Should a copy of this file be kept
forceUpdate - Should file be checked-in even if content is unchanged
status - A valid changed status
attrNums - list of attribute numbers that should be updated on check in. Values should be set on the object itself beforehand
contentEncoding - Specifies the content encoding for the new revision to be created. If not supplied, standard encoding is used. See TextEncodings.java for possible values.
Returns:
DimensionsResult the result of the operation

undoCheckout

DimensionsResult undoCheckout()
Removes the lock from a checked out item revision. The repository file instance is not valid any more after calling undoCheckout()

Returns:
DimensionsResult the result of the operation

undoCheckout

DimensionsResult undoCheckout(boolean keep,
                              java.lang.String userFileName)
Removes the lock from a checked out item revision. The repository file instance is not valid any more after calling undoCheckout()

Parameters:
keep - keep the local file but reset metadata to original.
userFileName - The location of the file where the previous revision should be fetched to and where the corresponding metadata will be updated. This parameter should be passed in if the local file has been moved in the meantime. **AB** This parameter is not used yet, but will be.
Returns:
DimensionsResult the result of the operation

removeFromProject

DimensionsResult removeFromProject(Project project,
                                   boolean all)
Removes this item revision from the given project. If null is passed in, it is being removed from the project this item revision is related to.

Parameters:
project - The project the item revision should be removed from
all - Indicates whether all revisions of the item should be removed from project or only the current one
Returns:
DimensionsResult The result of the operation
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if both the passed in project and the project related to the item are null

removeFromProject

DimensionsResult removeFromProject(Project project,
                                   boolean all,
                                   java.lang.String[] requestIds)
Removes this item revision from the given project. If null is passed in, it is being removed from the project this item revision is related to.

Parameters:
project - The project the item revision should be removed from
all - Indicates whether all revisions of the item should be removed from project or only the current one
requestIds - array of request Ids for the command
Returns:
DimensionsResult The result of the operation
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if both the passed in project and the project related to the item are null

setRepositoryPath

DimensionsResult setRepositoryPath(java.lang.String newRepositoryPath)
Renames or moves an item within the project by setting a new file name and/or setting a new path name. Path elements should be separated by "/". The path name has to be relative, means it should not begin with an intial separator. It should not have a trailing separator except in case of a DirectoryItem. The path name has to contain the file name itself.

Parameters:
newRepositoryPath - The new path (including file name) of the item within the repository
Returns:
DimensionsResult The result of the operation

setRepositoryPath

DimensionsResult setRepositoryPath(java.lang.String newRepositoryPath,
                                   java.lang.String[] requestIds)
Renames or moves an item within the project by setting a new file name and/or setting a new path name. Path elements should be separated by "/". The path name has to be relative, means it should not begin with an initial separator. It should not have a trailing separator except in case of a DirectoryItem. The path name has to contain the file name itself.

Parameters:
newRepositoryPath - The new path (including file name) of the item within the repository
requestIds - array of request Ids for the command
Returns:
DimensionsResult The result of the operation

getRevisionHistory

java.util.List getRevisionHistory(boolean all)
Retrieves a list of ItemRevisionHistoryRec objects for the current item revision (if all = false) or all revision of the item belonging to the current item revision (if all = true)

Parameters:
all - whether all revision history records should be retrieved for the item or just the ones for the item revision
Returns:
List of ItemRevisionHistoryRec objects

deploy

@Deprecated
DimensionsResult deploy(java.lang.String stage,
                                   java.lang.String comment)
Deprecated. As of CM 12.1, use the promote(String, String) or demote(String, String) methods instead.

Deploys an item to the given stage using CM 2009 R2 stage deployment. Promotion or demotion to a stage has replaced stage deployment as of CM 12.1 or later.

Parameters:
stage - The target stage to deploy to.
comment - The comment applied to the stage deployment.
Returns:
DimensionsResult The result of the operation.

comment - The comment applied.

DimensionsResult The result of the operation.

mergeItemRevisions

DimensionsResult mergeItemRevisions(java.util.List revisionsToMerge,
                                    java.lang.String newRevision,
                                    java.lang.String userFileName,
                                    java.lang.String comment,
                                    java.util.List requestIds,
                                    boolean keep,
                                    java.lang.String contentEncoding)
Merges item revisions, creates a new revision (newRevision) from this current item revision (the current item revision is handled as the primary item revision for the merge item command). Relates the given Request Ids, updates the attributes that are set on this item revision. The content of the new (merged) revision is taken from the file given by userFileName.

Parameters:
revisionsToMerge - List of revision names that should be merged into the new revision
newRevision - The name of the new revision to be created
userFileName - The file containing the merged contents of all the item revisions
comment - The comment to be applied for the new revision
requestIds - List of request Ids to be related
keep - whether the user file should be kept in the user area
contentEncoding - Specifies the content encoding for the new revision to be created. If not supplied, standard encoding is used. See TextEncodings.java for possible values.
Returns:
DimensionsResult result

mergeItemRevisions

DimensionsResult mergeItemRevisions(java.util.List revisionsToMerge,
                                    java.lang.String newRevision,
                                    java.lang.String userFileName,
                                    java.lang.String comment,
                                    java.util.List requestIds,
                                    boolean keep)
Merges item revisions, creates a new revision (newRevision) from this current item revision (the current item revision is handled as the primary item revision for the merge item command). Relates the given Request Ids, updates the attributes that are set on this item revision. The content of the new (merged) revision is taken from the file given by userFileName.

Parameters:
revisionsToMerge - List of revision names that should be merged into the new revision
newRevision - The name of the new revision to be created
userFileName - The file containing the merged contents of all the item revisions
comment - The comment to be applied for the new revision
requestIds - List of request Ids to be related
keep - whether the user file should be kept in the user area
Returns:
DimensionsResult result

reviseExtractedRevision

DimensionsResult reviseExtractedRevision(java.lang.String userFileName,
                                         java.lang.String newRevision)
The use of this method is discouraged. In projects, check in, check out and merge should be used in preference to revise. This method may change in a future release. This method can only be called on checked out (extracted) item revisions. It "revises" a checked out item revision to appear that it has been checked out from the tip. Requests and attributes are taken from the originally checked out item revision

Parameters:
userFileName - The user file name of the checked out file. This is used to change the metadata file accordingly.
newRevision - The name of the new revision to be created.
Returns:
DimensionsResult result

updateExtractedRevision

@Deprecated
DimensionsResult updateExtractedRevision(java.lang.String userFileName,
                                                    java.lang.String newRevision)
Deprecated. As of CM 2009 R2, use the reviseExtractedRevision(String, String) method instead.

Use of this method is discouraged.
